But said taunt can also be heard by the playing team thus adding more to the spam. As one person starts
votesHelpful: others will also start and continue forth resulting into a spam-o-thon. Unfortunately
votesTotal: there are no squelching in this game. Hope you like hearing that audio spam! Oh wait quitting out of the match is still a viable solution. Thank goodness!\n\nAll in all
votesFunny: don't. There are better games both within Steam and even out of it that can satisfy both a MOBA-type of gamers and platformer gamers without resorting to this one. This one looks nice but it's inner layers hide such frustrating flaws that ruin the overall coolness.\n\nFinal silly thoughs : I sometimes imagine this game as a Saturday morning cartoon. The settings does make it viable and will the menagerie of quirky characters..."

reviewText:
Sadly, I am going to have to agree with many of the other reviewers here. The new XP system has broken the game. I'm all for making moves to increase game speed, but this move makes games impossible or incredibly easy, depending on how the dice roll for you at match making. If you have a leaver and a bot fills in until another player can be found, you're out of luck. The other team will quickly overtake you in damage, even if you play flawlessly. Have a feeder? He WILL lose you the game, and there is nothing you can do.

The last game I played, I was 6-0, doing pretty well. I was completely maxed on upgrades. Unfortunately, I had a team member who fed a bit, and we started out with a bot for the first 5 minutes. Try as I might, no matter how many times I bested the other team and pushed them into a retreat, they would simply pick up a kill from one of my team mates and bide their time. Eventually, they rushed our base, and there was nothing I could do.

I would have picked this game over any other MOBA before trying it with the new patch. Now, I'm not so sure.

reviewText:
This was a hard game to get people into, especially if one has a bad taste from the MOBA-genre in general, but now it's damn near impossible to get newer folks to play. I love the characters, abilities, graphic style, and the flow of the fight especially in a team of friends, but some recent updates have marred the former image of Awesomenauts.

For players from the pre-XP system era, like myself, some are able to work past the changes but almost all of us dislike the system for a number of reasons. Notice though how I said work." The shorter game span and snowballing was really not necessary since there already was a leveling system in place before (Solar currency and maxing items on a character).

But now that system is still in effect... with an additional layer of HP and damage % upgrades doled out instantly for player kills and droid/creep kills. There's no strategy involved with that; it's merely a grind to see who is a better farmer. Making this not only like "other MOBA games" but also causing players to play more selfishly
date: stealing health creeps for XP instead saving for a heal
recommended: or ignoring a push and focusing on kills.\n\nI still recommend this game because it's near and dear to me - but it has a steeper learning curve than it previously had without any real value added
hoursPlayed: unfortunately."

reviewText:
Enjoy the idea of MOBAs but just aren't any good at RTS games? No problem. Ronimo got your back. By fusing the MOBA concept with a 2D platformer, they made a game that's quite simply: Awesome!

There are some issues of course, mainly the matchmaking system. But just like LoL before it, it has improved a lot since it launched.

Like most MOBAs, it's still preferable to be played with friends but at least the community isn't as nasty as most other online games. From my personal experience anyway.

On the more technical side, the game is really pretty. The animation is really smooth, and the art direction is top notch, provided you like the idea of playing a game that satires 80s saturday morning cartoons.

I definitely recommend this game to anyone with an interest in MOBAs or online multiplayer games.

reviewText:
its clear from playing for only a few hundred hours this game has potential but unfortunatley the devs cannot properly balance characters proplerly , and have little idea how to implement certain skills for the characters. some characteres have loads of skill and versatility others have very little.matchmaking is a joke too, being pared with people of little skill only to find that you loose the game to find your ranking decreases to be paired with even worse people. how i got through league 3 to 2 is simply amazing but im stil being paried with people from leagues 4 and 5 who cannot hold there own as a group let alone god forbid they stray from the pack.. awful awful game. if they ever do soemthing about the yuri carry and his hoover up money bendy slowing laser with a heal and slow bubble whilst flying and laying 10plus mines everywhere that might be a start. also the stealth characters need a change as permament stealth is a game breaker, even more so when u factor in that there is no direct counter to stealth play, not a singe character or perk is available to counter stealth.

finally this is apparantly  a recent change, the xp levlling system, what a joke , if your team is identical but behind in levels you will do less damage and have less health. so what do people do early on rush out and try to get kills cause they beleive that this will give them an advatage. so invariably people die a lot, feed get fed up and then leave ruining the game for everyone else. if the levelling bonus was not implemented until level 5  so that no increase to stats was available till level 5 i could understand , it might stop the intial reckles push early game as not all nauts scale the same way early on, some are very slow to build up and take time and money (in game) so a few early deaths mean that it cna be over very soon. this is apparantly wht the devs wanted to speed games up, but essentially it becomes a white wash with very few comebacks at being made if even possible.

my opinion if the developers actually want a game that plays well and is popular they might want to start looking at character versatility.
ps look at some of the older chars, raelyn has to be the weakest naut in the game now, absolutely no real abililty to counter anyone successfuly, shes a glass cannon which can be easily shut down or down right avoided, my own personal opinion is that she of all other chars needs a complete re work to the way she should be played, less damage maybe and more skills to employ, like a choice on snipe to break stealth, or a rift that goes both up and down or damage over time on succsesful hit. or hell maybe even the ablilty to clear a lane of droids like she used to be able to do but now her damage is so weak and pathetic against driods she can barely clear unles she uses rift and then she is defensless. what about a choice of penetration or a better sniping sheild, maybe a shield that only expose the back of the character, or one that is made of the same stuff as skrees turret god knows that when that is dropped it takes an eternity to destroy it single handedley

her blaster has the option for penetration but does not do so for turrets this ought to change too if its got penetration then it should do exaclty that

awful awful game avoid, unless its on offer at 90pence or something silly like that
ps the new map they have made is bloody awful too, not much right with awful nauts these days and ive only done 300 hours or so, probly wont be doing much more im glad to say

also the number of disconnects which cause your rank to decrease are all unforgivable , if they had this game with a proper server instead of peer to peer that might  help but they cannot have dedicated servers apparantly,. if there was a button that was worse than not recommend i would have selected that as the no" does not seem to convey the awful feeling you will get playing this game post 2.13 patch avoid unless very very cheap"

reviewText:
You are probably saying to yourself why would I buy this game when clearly there are better MOBA's like LOL or Dota 2? Why would I go through the trouble of paying for this game when I could play them?" Well if you have found yourself asking that I have plenty of reasons why Awesomenauts is far greater than any MOBA I have played before.

To begin with I find the community absolutely great. There is the occasional ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• who will scream "Lol you suck" in chat but apart from that I find that Awesomenauts attracts a great deal of funny and good sportsmanship players. I don't really have too many MOBA's I have played to compare communities with but I played one game of Dota and it had me being called a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing noob and... yeah so I never played again. I'm not too sure if I just got unlucky but it didn't seem like a great community of people to be playing with. Everyone (well most) in Awesomenauts just want to have fun!

Then there is the way the game looks detail wise. This may just be me but I find myself looking in wonder at all the detail the developers put into the game
date: no cartoon games should look this good. All the little things that I just can't help but really apreciate. How the background is animated
recommended:
how in one of the maps you can see sunlight flaring through the trees. The way the water captures your characters reflection seems so awesome compared to other games I have played with water. Also something I really like about the character selection screen is how the characters animate and shine.

Ronimo has done an amazing job creating so many characters all with completely different attack skills and ways to help out your team. I often find that people will always complain in chat about how overpowered a character is and yet I have seen every character be played so well. It really matters on how you use a certain character however some have a huge variation to how you can use them. This gives it a ginormous strategy aspect to the game (as most MOBA's do).

So to sum it all up if you want to get that warm fuzzy feeling you get after killing someone in a video game try this game because every time I kill someone I feel like I have just gotten a cookie. And if you have given up on playing MOBA's because of how people treat you over the internet give this game a go
hoursPlayed: it will surprise you."

reviewText: Personally I highly recommend this game both because it's very addicting, and also that it's art is very wellmade. Apart from other MOBA games, this one got humour and a unique atmosphere that makes the icing on the cake. Now when Awesomenauts: Starstorm has been released, the game will be better than ever! The only thing I wish were implemented in the game, was a campaign. If that would be added, you'd have a whole singleplayer experience. Though this game is a MOBA game, so it would probably not be appropriate for it's genre. Apart from that, the game is very well-made and I have encountered almost no bugs, for the many hours I've spent on this game. Incredible work you've put there Ronimo! 10 euro is totally worth to spend, if you want an incredible experience! You can always buy a three-pack to create your own team. (It's 3vs3 MOBA styled game.) Have fun if you consider buying it! ;)\n//Firren

reviewText:
Awesomenauts is a game with so many issues I cannot go into detail here without boring you. The game used to be fantastic when it was first released to the PC, and the first few updates were great additions to the game. But the ones forever afterwards have only damaged the game further and further.

Matchmaking is unfair. You will be paired with two new players against three complete veterans. The balance is unfair. There are so many characters in-game now, that the others cannot be balanced properly against each other anymore like they used to be. Comebacks are unfair. There is now an XP system, which means games are immediately decided from the very first few kills in the game.

The future doesn't look bright either. There is now pay-to-play-new-characters in the game. You won't know counters to those characters or how they work without using your money. The playerbase no longer budges on free weekends or discounts.

This game is not a casual drop-in drop-out game like it used to be advertised anymore. It is a poorly attempted competitive game, which resulted in a disastrous outcome. If your game is not broken and people are enjoying it, you do not need to fix" it with updates that people do not want.

- - - - -

reviewText:
Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†‚òê Worth full-price¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†‚òê Only on sales

+ Unique concept of a side-scroll/platformer MOBA.
+ Original and awesomely designed characters complete with their own theme songs!.
+ Fluid and fast-paced action.
+ Friggin' theme songs!
+ And killing spree remixes!

- The combination of P2P, poor matchmaking, and TrueSkill rank system.
- Shoddy balance.
- Nonexistent playerbase.
- Rectal cancer.

An 80s/90s Saturday morning cartoon themed 2D MOBA. Gameplay-wise it's a lot of fun. In fact, If you couldn't care less about ranked or climbing the ladder and just want to have a good time PvPing with friends in a game with all the MOBA elements then, by all means, go right ahead. But then, why not ditch the laning & jungling and grab any one of the 261 vastly superior Super Smash Bros. games. I honestly can't recommend this to anyone looking for a serious MOBA. Especially when it doesn't nail the 'massively online' bit.

The matchmaking system on ranked (the only mode that matters) is utter balls. The overall online experience is a laggy pile of feces 72% of the time due to the netcode and lack of dedicated servers, and is in desperate need of an overhaul! The TrueSkill rank system is the proverbial cherry on top of it all, ensuring that when you  do  lose because of either of the aforementioned (or both) you'll be severely punished for it. That being said, the game itself can be a ton of fun when played casually either in split-screen or privately with people in the same region.

Here's an example of what a session of Awesomenauts is like at the very start of a new season: You solo queue and manage to roflstomp a few games and get placed in the Awesomantium league (league 1). A lag spike here and there, no biggie. You proceed to faceroll some more games, miraculously, without any major issues. Ranking-up a few more spots at a time. But then, inevitably, you get dropped into either:

A) the end of a game that's mere seconds away from ending,
5) one that's utterly one-sided with absolutely no chance of mounting a comeback,
31) lagcity,
9) a straight up instant disconnection as soon as you connect due to the host's dial-up Internet access,
Q) All the above,

resulting in your first loss and (here's the kicker) get set back anywhere from fifty to  HUNDREDS  upon  HUNDREDS  of ranks depending on how much lower the enemy team's players were rank-wise. DCing from a game with a big enough rank gap and you can even throw in a demotion to a league or two down. At this point, re-queueing and attempting to crawl your way back up is not an option. It's very likely that you'd just end up getting shafted again by any/all the above. Plus, the difference between points earned and lost is just simply impossible to offset anyway.

Queueing with friends? Great! Attempting to reconnect back into your game can more often than not result in yet  another  <insert BS here>, which (you guessed it!) sets you back even further. Hours invested down the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• all in the span of seconds. A setback from which you have no hope of remedying for the remainder of that season (60 days).

Needless to say, this happens every.. single.. season...

Now, surely you'd think the devs are aware and on top of the situation. Well, what do they have to say you ask? ‚ÄúUmm.. here's some more $5 skins!! :D‚Äù

Being a huge MOBA fan since the days of the original DotA and all the hero-based mods on Warcraft III (Hero Wars players where you at), I really loved Awesomenaut's unique 2D spin on the genre, along with its style and music. It's original af and a nice breath of fresh air in a stagnating genre. It really sets itself apart from the current ‚Äútop‚Äù MOBAs like DotA2 and League of Legends which are just blatant knock offs and re-skins of all the mods that kicked off the genre (and that I played to death) and ultimately have nothing new to contribute. So, when I discovered Awesomenauts I overlooked the issues and really tried being patient with the devs in the hopes that they'd sort it all out and get the game out there in a big way. I supported them and even backed their Kickstarter. But, after having been on board for no less than ten seasons, and after countless posts on the forums by the community and their most dedicated players, Ronimo have, and indeed continue to, ignore these glaring issues and treat the game like a pos cash cow. They prioritize working on ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• like an AI editor, a map editor, creating new skins, releasing different in-game announcers, redesigning the UI, and  talking  about the 5th map-- the fabled ‚ÄúStarstorm‚Äù map instead. That's when they're not busy further breaking the joke that the game's balance is. During their Kickstarter campaign, they managed to raise over $500,000 and there wasn't so much as a  single  attempt at addressing these issues.

So, unless you intend on playing this game with friends, either locally or in private matches online, spare yourself the buttdamage and skip it. Your cash is better spent elsewhere, if at all- there are much,  much  better  free  alternatives out there made by devs that actually give half a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• (*cough* Heroes of the Storm *cough*).

GGs Ronimo! Game had a ton of potential but, sadly, Awesome not.

reviewText:
For people looking to play this game, I highly suggest looking at other MOBAs. This one is OK for gameplay and fun, but when it comes to the community, it is absolutely horrible. There are people who purposely de-league themselves so they can play on lower league games and pretty much guarantee themselves wins. It is nealy impossible to get anywhere unless you absolutely pour hours upon hours into this game because you want to get better. Chances are, you might not get any better because you're fighting people who are highly advanced in skill level in a low skill-level game. You will not believe how many times you will go up a league, only to immediately drop one because you fought against ex-league 2s or bottom-line 1s. I can never seem to get above rank 8. I reach rank 7, and the next match, I lose and am de-leagued again.

Pros? Fun gameplay, graphics are cartoony and nice, the controls are rather smooth, and it makes for a good action platform-jumping, run-n-gun MOBA.

Cons? You won't get anywhere with the cheap community it has.. People are not ashamed to admit that they purposely de-league themselves to play lower ranked games. It's rather distasteful and it made me remember why I stopped playing it.

Stay away from this game, you won't have any fun because you'll constantly get rolled.

Thank you.
-Alpha Gamma

reviewText:
Awesomenauts.... Awesomenauts awesomenauts awesomenauts.

First thing's first. The name is annoying to think of, to type etc. maybe it's the built up frustration I have for this game.

Simple review, 2-D, Baby's First MOBA, a few maps, a few characters, 3v3 etc. It is a toned down MOBA.

I don't really want to say this but if you are bad at MOBAs start here. you can learn the basics of how to play a MOBA correctly here, you can have a pretty darn good time here. The community is pretty decent, the matchmaking puts you with people of your skill level, the game has the basics of a maybe in a little more simple format, examples:

Most MOBAs                               Awesomenauts
5v5                                               3v3
3 Lanes                                        2 or 1 Lane
Jungle(3+monsters)                     Solar boss (1 Jungle Boss Monster per side) (not on all maps)
20+ players                                   10-20 Players
Large store for buying upgrades      Very small store for buying upgrades
Money and EXP                             Money

I like the game, honest. BUT it's not something that people who like to play MOBAs often would like very much. It's great for noobies to the Genre, not so fun for outsiders or vets.

And I know there are probably some serious vets in Awesomenauts, I don't know why you keep playing, maybe it's because you're used to the game, whatever, not my boat, I speak for myself and people like me then.


Story: X/10
Gameplay: 7/10 (Not very challenging, you just learn the game and practice.)
Presentation: 9/10 (The kind of art that revolves around cheap giggle, I'm looking at you Ted Mc Pain.)
Soundtrack: 9/10 (the sound exists.)
Replayability: 8/10 (Maybe you'll ragequit.)

Bring your friends, destroy your enemies, go buy Awesomenauts now!

reviewText:
Awesomenauts brings a fresh spin on a familiar format. It performs adequately with the formula we're familiar with in team-based DOTA style games: you have lanes, turrets, minion waves, and a base. Choose your character, destroy enemy structures. Pretty standard stuff.

Where Awesomenauts stands out is in it's character. The art and gameplay transport us back to the golden age of 2D side-scrolling, bringing back memories of (insert your favorite 2D title here) while you savor the smart-mouthed slams each of the 'nauts bring to the battlefield. You'll find yourself addicted, and in short order.

That said, the limited community for the game precludes Ronimo from separating premade teams from solo players. What this means for you is that a match will frequently be slanted heavily against you if you play alone. On the same token, the converse is true.

Overall, I'd give it 4 rainbow unicorn poops out of 5.

reviewText:
AT A GLANCE(Full review follows below)

Game Name: Awesomenauts
Original Release: 2012
Genre Tags: 2D; MOBA; Platformer; Multiplayer
My Overall Grade: A
Estimated Playtime (Campaign): N/A
Multiplayer Aspect: Primary
Recommended To: Established fans of the genre; Those intrigued by the genre; Multiplayer gamers
REVIEWAwesomenauts is a simplistic and fun little MOBA that has a moderate learning curve and is mostly easy to get the hang of.  It isn‚Äôt as complex or competitive as many other MOBAs out there. This is a good thing for anyone who wants to play some PVP without having to deal with an overly complicated game and an overly angry playerbase.

The game plays out in matches on small 2D arena-like maps.  At the start of each match, the players can choose from several Awesomenauts (read: heroes) to play as, each with their own different abilities.  Each match takes about a half hour or so, as two teams push with ‚Äúcreeps‚Äù to destroy towers and the enemy base. Sound familiar? So it plays like a traditional MOBA, but in 2D.

The combination of the distinctiveness of 2D MOBA combat and the well-designed abilities for the different Awesomenauts creates a pretty enjoyable gameplay experience. It is fun to play around with the different character combinations to see what fun you can have with the unique gameplay. Also, there is a pretty decent playerbase and the developers have consistently been updating the game and creating new content, so it appears to have a stable heartbeat.

Awesomenauts would be a good game to consider if you are someone who is interested in playing a PVP game for fun and don‚Äôt want to deal with the hostility of the community of other MOBAs. The ranking system does its best to keep everyone around where they should win 50% of the time. But that doesn‚Äôt stop some people from believing they should be winning every single match; luckily they‚Äôre the minority in this game. Due to the simplicity of the mechanics and the lighthearted nature of the game, the community tends to be a little less unnecessarily competitive than in other games.

EDIT: As of the start of the year 2016, it has been a while since I have played this. The developers have continued to support the game with updates. I cannot speak about the current state of certain aspects of the game which may have changed since I have last played, but I believe what I have said here still holds true to the core game.

Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations!

reviewText:
The short version of this game is that you join a team consisting of 3 characters, and begin trying to kill the hell out of each other until one team gets a big enough advantage to push through a couple massive turrets and destroy their opponents base.

The longer version involves a throwback to when cartoons were good (late 80s and most of the early-mid 90s), with silly themes and backtories on all of the characters. Each character has their own unique set of skills and abilities. Each character excells in one way or another. For example, Ayla (the psychotic little alien girl) can create a rage bubble around her which damages enemies nearby while healing her. On the other hand, Derpl Zork (the dumber-than-plankton heir to one of the biggest fortunes in the galexy) can transform his walking desk/secretary/death machine into a turret which can lay down a lot of firepower, including nukes.


The games themselves are quick and fun, although the ranking system is imperfect due to a playerbase not large enough to support the higher rank players.
voteText: 9 of 14 people (64%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Awesomenauts is one of those games you will either like or not.

I had a couple hours of fun with this game, but that is pretty much it, much like DOTA (which is quite different than this, yes), it plays out in the sense that two teams duke it out against eachother. Each player (human or bot) gains levels and more skills as the game progresses, and finally either team has pushed far enough to destroy the other team's main objective, and that is it. The game features dozens of characters to play and you will certainly find a couple favorites that you will have fun playing, moreso than others.

I am pretty confident that a group of people (2-6) playing together (and against eachother) can have a lot of fun with Awesomenauts, and I would definitely recommend it for that.

reviewText:
This game is unique. There has never been a game similar to this one.



Yes, it follows the basic MOBA formula of creeps/towers/heroes"/loadout builds/base
date: but past that everything changes.\nMechanically speaking
recommended: the game uses a 2D platforming free-side-scrolling approach. You move using the keyboard
hoursPlayed: and aim/attack using your mouse. Controllers can be used as well

helpfulPercent: each with an entirely different layout. Generally
votesHelpful: 2 lanes exist
votesTotal: though most maps have open areas and choke-points.\n\nThe "heroes" (nauts) are incredibly different from each other
votesFunny: in terms of abilities and playstyle. There's a chameleon assassin that goes invisible
commentsCount: a russian monkey that flies using a jetpack
column16: a squid that anchors you in place
column17: an overweight viking that hurls you into the air
column18: an all-eating creature that spawns stationary minions
column19: a floating brain that controls a swarm of drones
column20: etc. for a total of 16 nauts
column21: plus an additional 5 in the still growing expansion (the expansion marked a first step towards a continuous development effort
column22: which I mention further ahead
column23: and is not in any way pay-to-win). Each naut has its own learning curve. This makes the game spectacularly varied
column24: as not only are the nauts unique from each other
column25: the 3 naut teams mean there are a huge number of possible combinations
column26: which in turn mean a huge number of approaches to a single match. Not to mention that many nauts can steer their own style in very diverse directions depending on which items they go for in their build.\n\nLast
column27: but not least

column30:
but instead a sort of nostalgic-childhood-saturday-morning-cartoon-fun.
Competitive? Yes. But also a game in which you can kill a flying monkey by having a fat viking throw an exploding gnome at its face.

It is also essential to point out that the developers are still very much working on the game. Yes
column31: it was released back in 2012

column34: who frequently post in the forums
column35: intend to keep working and adding features to the game

column37: and the players are having a blast watching the game grow and having their feedback taken seriously. (this is not early access in any way)\n\nAll in all
column41:
and surprising strategic and tactical complexity.


Grab it. Play it. Love it.

Great game, really is. Just a few issues here and there, and one gamebreaker.

CONS:

reviewText: A game like this would be a really good idea for a story-driven platformer but it works just fine as a side-scrolling, casually competitive multiplayer game. The music is great, the characters are hilarious and the art is very well done. You can play alone against bots if you don't want to play against real people and you'll still be able to level up that way to unlock new characters and abilities. More maps to choose from would be nice for a little more variety, though.

reviewText: If you think this is a watered-down DOTA-like, then you're sadly mistaken. Awesomenauts makes the MOBA (side-note: I hate that term, but it's what everyone calls it, so meh) genre accessible to first time players whilst being hard to master. And on top of the wonderfully deep gameplay, the artwork is absolutely gorgeous-- hand-painted textures galore and a killer soundtrack (each Awesomenaut has their own theme song music that plays when they go on a Kill Streak!). You should get Awesomenauts if any of these apply: 1) You're a MOBA fan, 2) You enjoy games that encourage good teamwork, 3) You want a game with tons of replay-value, and/or 4) You want a game that gets balanced and gets new content added on a regular basis. I couldn't recommend Awesomenauts enough; it's really *that* good-- I've already put in over 100 hours of gametime over the 3 months or so that I've had it, and I plan on pouring many more into it over the coming years. GET IT. PLAY IT. LOVE IT.

reviewText: If you think this is a watered-down DOTA-like, then you're sadly mistaken. Awesomenauts makes the MOBA (side-note: I hate that term, but it's what everyone calls it, so meh) genre accessible to first time players whilst being hard to master. And on top of the wonderfully deep gameplay, the artwork is absolutely gorgeous-- hand-painted textures galore and a killer soundtrack (each Awesomenaut has their own theme song music that plays when they go on a Kill Streak!). You should get Awesomenauts if any of these apply: 1) You're a MOBA fan, 2) You enjoy games that encourage good teamwork, 3) You want a game with tons of replay-value, and/or 4) You want a game that gets balanced and gets new content added on a regular basis. I couldn't recommend Awesomenauts enough; it's really *that* good-- I've already put in over 100 hours of gametime over the 3 months or so that I've had it, and I plan on pouring many more into it over the coming years. GET IT. PLAY IT. LOVE IT.

reviewText:
Megaman meets League of Legends with a Saturday morning cartoon feel to it.  Play against bots by yourself, go online against other people or even call in your friends to take on bots, strangers or other friends.  It gets better though!  You can splitscreen the game between yourself and two friends locally.  Twelve different characters (more if you get the Starstorm) and counting, lots of fun maps to play and different ways to build your character.

Now you probably ask, what's different about this than LoL?  For starters, this game is entirely in 2D.  Second off, it's a platformer.  Your ability to run around, jump and navigate plays a lot in this game.  Third, I have played LoL and there's something that Awesomenauts does that LoL hasn't to my knowledge.  Each character has their own theme song and if you can get on a killing spree (3 kills) the character theme song starts playing for you immediately during the game.  What's that?  Didn't know the game had actual music?  Well it does, and guess what?  If you have the know how, you can change the music to whatever you want if you don't like the default tracks.

Shopping in this game is much easier as well.  No need to buy fifty varieties of an item as the game progresses, you can choose your characters loadout before you enter the match and buy whatever upgrade you want when you get the money.  One other thing about this game is the fact you don't need to enter a match from the very start, if there is a spot open, you can join a game already in progress.  So what are you waiting for?  Buy this game already.

reviewText: A MOBA for people who either don't enjoy or are afraid of other deeper games of the genre. Easy to pick up and learn, the matches are short, teams have only 3 members, there's a good number of characters and it's always updating. That alone reduces the potential for stress compared to Dota 2 or League of Legends. You can definitely play this casually every once in while but that's not to say the game lacks depth. Not of great fan of the soundtrack though. The Starstorm expansion is supposed to fix my biggest beef with the game: lack of a dual stick control scheme on gamepads.

reviewText:
Recipe for Awesomenauts:
Take 1 MOBA (I'm using DOTA, but you can use LOL if you like!). First, boil away that nasty control scheme, if we were making at RTS that'd be fine, but we want to get rid of that here until we're left with a tasty 2D platformer, but with that unmistakable MOBA flavour. Turn that hour long simmer up to a high heat of 15-20 minutes. Make sure you remove the denying and bizarre item scheme, you can choke on those easily. Add a dash of pop culture, but not too much! Finally, garnish with some delishious 80s cartoon goodness. Delicious!

Serves 1 - 6.

(The mute is available in game by hitting Tab by the way) the game is really darn fun. Every patch introduces new wrinkles and matches are usually competitive.

reviewText: It is hard to like game like this in my opinion. I mean, I like it a lot, and I am not the only one. Issues this game has are rather big though and can discourage you from playing . If you ever pick this game up, you will be frustrated. you will face lag and inbalance. I am facing these issues as well. But I still keep playing. Why? Because the feeling when you go on killing spree is pricelles. You feel like you did something great, something rewarding. Heck, you get to hear awesome ( most of times) remix of your theme song ( every character has one) when you go on killiing spree. I am not even talking about when you get some cool trick-shoot off, when you score triple kill and when your team goes AWESOME ( your team has to score 15 kills without dying), it is simply something not every multiplayer game has to offer. This is why I keep playing, just to experience these moments again and again. Howere, if you are going to buy this game, play it with friends. It is way more fun to experience those moments with your friend.

reviewText: With great animations, awesome characters, and a pumpin' set of tunes, Awesomenauts is probably, for me, one of the top MOBAs that can be played at this time (and probably for a long time after). reviewText:
Awesomenauts is a 2D 3v3 platforming MOBA with the style of 80s cartoon. I've sunk alot of time into this game and I've had a blast with it, and still do.

Pros:
-15 Unique characters with thier own upgrades that you can customize to fit your unique playstyle,
-Each character has thier own theme music as well as killing spree music
-Split screen capable up to 3 players
-Controller support, but plays just as awesome with keyboard and mouse
-Competitive Community (via the Awesomenauts Pro League)
-4 maps with unique platforming and terrian obstacles
-AI Modding support to make better bots
-Easy to learn, hard to master
-Quick matches normally taking 20-30 minutes per match.

Cons:
-Some of the community can be toxic
-A couple of maps favor some nauts better than others
-The drop-in
date: drop out" system of the game which many have faults with because Awesomenauts was originally a "casual" MOBA styled game.\n-Unable to coordinate with your teams before a match begins to see what characters they may be playing as or what map you are playing on next (The first part can be fixed by using a voice comms [Skype
hoursPlayed: TS3
voteText:
etc])
-Some people don't like how you have to obtain XP from completing matches to unlock new characters and loadout items for each character.

Notes:
There is also an expansion which is in development but will be bringing things like:
-Spectator Mode
-Replays (Released)
-5 characters (4 released)
-New map
-Custom games to play different modes such as Team Deathmatch
-Many other features

I would also like to add one more note that even if you don't have the expansion
helpfulPercent:
you can join a friend's custom game to play on the new map as well as play custom game modes through joining your friend.

Overall rating: 9.5/10

"

reviewText:
Ever wanted to splice a bug and a dog?
Tie a jetpack to a chimp and strap some mines to it?
Listen to a british squid make fabulous puns about his trusty anchor?

The visuals are impressive with regular updates, but if i had to really nitpick, i'd say the original pre-game menu was better than the current one, purely because it was good fun to find what combinations would be effective while waiting for the game to load instead of skimming what everything does because you want to actually play the game.
Matchmaking could use a bit of work, but i'm sure a lot of people are already aware of that.
Other than that, a really solid game with very minor issues that can be easily sorted out.

In order to bring the war to a conclusion, mercenaries called Awesomenauts" have been hired to help aid the two factions. The main objective is to destroy the other team's solar drill. (solar being a precious liquid metal) You will have to go through turrents  and droids blocking your path

reviewText: Awesomenauts is a 3-on-3 2D MOBA game. You start out with a limited selection of ‚ÄòNauts, but unlocking the other ones is done rather quickly.\nEventually, you‚Äôll have a selection of 15 heroes to choose from (19 if you also purchased ‚ÄúStarstorm‚Äù) each with 2 special skills and a regular attack. Further levelling up of your profile will unlock special features for your skills, like lower cooldowns or larger range. So people who have played longer will have a wider variety of features in their skills.\nAwesomenauts also doesn‚Äôt have a steep learning curve like other MOBA games, so it‚Äôs fairly easy to jump into the game and get playing. However, it‚Äôs still varied enough to not grow stale quickly and the skill ceiling is high enough to keep you playing and trying to improve.

reviewText:
You and a couple of friends looking for a MOBA to play together but can't be bothered with the seriousness and advanced tactics of LoL / Dota? Then 'nauts is the charming MOBA for you. Don't get me wrong, it has a LOT of depth and teamwork plays a huge part, but unlike in other MOBAs it's possible to play this game in a more casual manner, it's much more pick-up-and-play and has a more reasonable learning curve than other MOBAs on the market.

This charming 2D 80's-cartoon style MOBA has the approchability to make it your first MOBA, and the complexity to keep you coming back.

Positives:
- Fairly freuent updates which introduce new characters and many other cool things
- Good selection of mostly balanced varied characters
- Good build variety, no two players will play a character absolutely identically
- Charming visuals and interesting map design and hazards
- Catchy soundtrack
- Simply fun with friends
- Prestige system and achievement gives you more reasons to keep playing

Negatives:
- Developers often ignore what the players want in terms of character changes
- No dedicated servers, pier-to-pier means some people with not so good internet connection may experience lag
- Lack of maps. Not a huge problem, 4 maps is fine but having a couple more thrown into the mix would be fun. I know they're working on a big one now, but still more would be nice
- Clunk
voteText: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
This is not like your Standard MOBA, its a 2D MOBA.
There are 'Nauts' (basically just character) Each character has its own special ability. Its 3 v 3 so that makes it alot of harder to control the map. Of course are there Minions, towers and a shop :). Just like LoL DotA 2. But its not easy to get in the game, it takes alot of skills to master, since this is a 2D moba. You'll need a different play style cause the maps are not big. No jungles. So this is big change.
The multiplayer is decent, cause there is Lag and someone can leave the server and join again and pick another character (no punish. And there's one thing that annoys me alot is the DLC. You have to pay REAL money for 'Nauts', skins. Like if i play online i see no one with a skin. And Yes i bought the Starstorm dlc, i think thats the best DLC they made. Cause there are new characters AI options and more! And yes the controller works really good on this game actually had no problems with the controller. Splitscreens is actually well done :).
The game is really fun!
If you are going to buy this game i recommend you to buy the Starstorm DLC for the extra 'nauts' and Options.
And yes there are AI options if you buy Starstorm. Cause the AI is not the best in this game without it. Not alot of maps.
Rating: 8,5/10 donuts.
Nice price, nice game

reviewText:
This is yet another game that I have returned to long after release only to be pleasantly surprised.  I wasn't interested in playing this game whatsoever after trying it on release, as everything seemed extremely unbalanced.  Although the mechanics and ideas behind most of the characters were interesting, there were only a few characters.  This caused the OP characters to be really, really OP.  There wasn't a ranking system yet, so very skilled players would be mixed in with brand new players, making gameplay frustrating for those just entering into Awesomenauts PvP.

They have refined this game into a jewel.  As a long time MOBA player (I have played Smite and LoL extensively, and sampled DOTA, Newearth, and a few others), this MOBA holds a special place in my heart.  The fact that you can modify the base skills to do different things is really a joy - it makes it so that you can tailor your favorite character to counter whatever team you are playing against.  Although the same can be accomplished with items in other MOBAs, the way they approach items in Awesomenauts makes the choices easy and good for a casual, enjoyable experience.  The community seems very welcoming, and the UI is clean and modern.  I love the way the profiles are set up, and am always interested in checking up on my own stats.  The side scrolling aspect will at first pose a challenge for other long time MOBA players, but the new perspective is easily mastered and adds another dimension to gameplay.

The variety of maps and the different traps" and features of each is really awesome.  The fact that your spawn timer mostly consists of flying to earth in a rocket ship while picking up solar is badass
date: and makes staying engaged in the game easy and fun.  I'd definitely suggest this game to anyone looking to pick up a simple
recommended: fun MOBA - there's something for both new players looking to learn the ropes of MOBAS
hoursPlayed: and experienced players looking to just have a bit of relaxing fun.\n\nI look forward to playing this game for a long time to come
voteText: and purchasing the expansions when I get the chance.\n"

reviewText: Though it's hard to choose a favorite game, Awesomenauts is up there for me. It is somehow casual while being competitive, using it's bright and silly graphics to keep a light tone to it. It is incredibly fun, and the most replayable game I have ever played. Each team having 3 players makes for a great time with 2 of your friends. However, this can also be a source of irritation for solo players, as teams with communication have a giant advantage. This can turn into a bigger problem as the Awesomenauts community is very small, making it impossible to match pre-made teams with solely other pre-mades. As a result of this, many players are turned away from the game early on, especially due to poor matchmaking at some less busy times of day. Through all of this, I urge everyone to try this game and to not give up during the first few matches. The fun only increases with your experience.\n\n9/10

reviewText: I am really impressed with the direction ubisoft took with this game. Being the first game developed in Minsk, Belarus by a Eastern Orthodox female orphanage in 1913, the graphics exceeded the standard of its time.  Some astronomers consider this game to have been the reason for the economic boom in West Africa for the following 40 years.  The gameplay is very intricate.  This game is historically recognized as the first 2nd person hack-and-slash dungeon crawler taking place during the Shang dynasty in ancient Australia to incorporate 7-player split screen gameplay.  Unfortunately, the games sales plummeted due to Howard Taft's embargo of 1772, where the shipping of the game was banned in Latin America, Hong Kong and the Zambian empire.  Hopefully our generation and game review websites such as Zynga will recognize the innovation this game provided.  10/10.

reviewText:
As someone who has been playing this game ever since it was released on PS3/XBOX 360 back in May 2012, I REALLY want to recommend people to play this game. There is a lot of fun in this game due to the 2D side-scrolling gameplay, which I find very interesting for a MOBA game back in 2012, and the fun characters including new ones (most of which is free) that roll out overtime. The maps can be challenging as cetain characters can take advantage of it. For example, when Ayla's Rage can damage driods under the area of top turrents (which I find BS sometimes) at Ribbit IV. Sentry's Black Hole Sun applies too as this ability can drag and hold players when placed under them despite some form of ground inbetween the players and the hole. Another thing I like is that matches are pretty fast compared to popular MOBAs like League of Legends, DOTA 2, etc. You don't have to spend almost an hour on ONE match. In Awesomenauts, the average match is about 15-20 minutes with the longest I've experienced is about 40 minutes (this is before the XP system).

But as I outweigh the pros and cons of this game, I find that the cons are slightly higher than the pros, especially with the new XP system. As some people mention it before, the purpose of the XP is to make matches go faster by creating a snowball effect. Any kills, whether it is creeps, driods, or other players, will raise their team level. On paper, the idea is great since in the past, there were some matches that drag out too long. As for execution, this is debatable. People who win a lot with this system will likely say there's little to no problems with it. People who lose a lot with this system will likely say the XP system is broken and unplayable. Personably, as someone who used to win a lot of games before, I can agree to the fact that this can be a problem. The XP system requires to have little to no mistakes when playing because every kill is exp points for the other team. Pair this up with the WONDERFUL matchmaking, those claims that this is unplayable may have some truth in it. The old system makes you work hard to gain a victory. The new system is on drugs as anybody, no matter what rank/league you are in, can simply win if one team is screwing up. It's subjective to how everyone feels about the XP system, but everyone can agree that this can be frustrating when you are paired up with team members who are either new to the game, new to the character they are playing as, or has no sense of teamwork or coordination. And honestly, I suffered way too much with that.

Other things to note is that there are no ranked matches, there is no surrender option, and there are matchmaking issues. For ranked matches, I don't understand why this does not exist since we have leagues/tiers, ranked points, and such. I want to play with experienced people without the need to go over to community and organize games. Not all of us has the time to go over to the fourms and ask if people wany to play. For me, I play it like a lot of multiplayer games: hit the matchmaking button and hope the team you are in is actually good. For surrenders, why isn't this a thing? If a game is going very bad to the point where you and your teammates cannot do anything but feed the enemy team, why can't we be given the option to surrender instead waiting for the enemy team to destroy almost every turrent and finally destroy the base. This happens way too often even though I tried to carry my team. I think we can prevent a good amount of people ragequiting and going AFK instead of waiting for the match to be over. If time is the issue (like people wanting to surrender less than five minutes in the game), then set the limit to activate surrunder at the 8-10 minute mark. For these two issues, it has been almost four years and Ronimo still haven't resolved this, or rather walked around it. Lastly on the AMAZING matchmaking, we can all agree that we had experienced being with bad teammates against very good players or being placed into a match where the team you are in has only one turrent left a handful of times. I understand that Ronimo is trying their best, especially since they are just indie developers, but why not just give us the option to choose a game instead of the matchmaking be random. Why not give us the option to prevent us from joining mid to late games randomly? This is infuriating because I have experienced this crap for so long.

It is also note that you lose more rank points if you leave a game versus losing a game (for those of you who care about your rank). While this encourages people to stay in their match and finish it (or wait till you lose), any disconnect is considered a leave. To be clear, leaving a game means losing half the experience points towards your league and unlockable skills (especially if you prestige) when you win a match. It may seem like an annoyance, but this is a warning for people who is tempted to leave a match just to find a game you can win in.

I know this is a very long review, but this is a game I have put so much time in since its original release, and only to feel like being stepped on due to these problems. And the thing is, I want this game to succeed. This game has a lot of potential to be a unique MOBA game that is diferent than the typical and popular MOBA games out there. If anything, I want to say that Awesomenauts is my favorite MOBA, but I can't. The game had undergone a lot of changes, for better or worse, over the years, and while it is not as bad as most people who didn't recommend this game says it is, this game still need a lot of tuning, epecially ever since the new XP system. I know the Overdrive expansion is coming soon with it promising better matchmaking. But as it stands right now, be very, very wary when considering to buy this game along with the Starstorm expansion. Wait for a sale if anything.

TL;DR: The game is mixed IMO due to frustrating issues, both common and personal, that has not been resolved or has been walked around. Wait for a sale.

reviewText:
I wouldn't classify Awesomenauts as being awesome, but it's mildly fun. Take a basic 2D platformer like Booster Trooper and turn it into a 3 vs 3 all out battle to destroy your opponents base, fighting through turrets along the way. I found the game content to be lacking in both character abilities and map selection--there are only 4 different maps, all identically laid out. All the characters have similar abilities which means they are all pretty evenly matched, but many of the abilities seem pretty useless. There are also unlockable abilities as you pursue the slow experience grind.

Matches last about 10-15 minutes and they are typically pretty lopsided, but occasionally you end up in an intense stalemate. The drop-in / drop-out support is excellent making it very quick and easy to find a game.

When they say Saturday morning is back" they aren't kidding--it's very cartoony

reviewText:
A fantastic collaberation of the Side-Scrolling Platformer and Moba genres crossed with some fighting game elements.  And while it certainly has it's problems, such as various glitches which the devs are working on fixing at this very moment and a few balance problems, this game is well worth looking in to.

Much like any other Moba-style games, or competitive games for that matter, Awesomenauts is very difficult to master.  I personally have thrown 1000+ hours into the game and I'm still not that great.  However unlike quite a few games out there which I will not name, it is very easy to get into the game and have a fantastic time.

Rather than spending the first fifteen or so minutes doing nothing but killing the creep waves and maybe some minor poke, it is completely possible to engage in a team fight within the first few minutes of a match, keeping it exciting for everyone participating.

If I were to rate Awesomenauts, I would give it a 7/10.  The score should be higher, however there are some outstanding issues which I just cannot pass over, such as a Peer to Peer connection system which quite often matches you against players with insane ping levels, or the fact that certain characters can't make jumps that other characters can.  However it is still an immense amount of fun and I have found that after 1000+ hours I'm still not bored of the game, do check it out!

reviewText:
Honestly one of my favorite games of all time, even if I'm not that great at it.

If you're familiar with the rise of MOBA games lately in the gaming space, then you're already a step in into understanding how the Awesomenauts roll. However, this game doesn't play like your DOTA 2's or your LoL's. It infuses 2D platforming (similar to Megaman games if you need a reference) and the aspects of a competitive MOBA into a 3v3 team fighting game.  While not needlessly complicated as say Dota 2, Awesomenauts draws in that same teamwork and building up your hero feeling all while giving you very direct control of your character. (You can even play with a controller, which is super great for living room PC's)

It's not a mindless action game, as how you work together with other and how you build up your hero will determine outcomes. (Sometimes the comebacks are nuts!) Ronimo game pours an incredible amount of love into this game and this shows off in every aspect - from the artstyle, the flavor text, the menus, the sound effects and oh god the music. Sonic Picnic's themes for every hero (and even cool remix's when you're doing great at the game) are nothing short of fantastic. Pick up the soundtrack if you can.

With the recent Starstorm expansion building up, you can count on future support as well. If you're looking for a fun 3v3 Moba-type game with less of a toxic community (imo, of course) you have to hit up the Awesomenauts.

reviewText: I got this game from a bundle and initially only launched it because my old computer could not run anything else. reviewText:
Awesomenauts is a 2D MOBA set in space! You'll be playing 3 VS 3 and trying to destroy the opposing teams 'Nauts, Towers and Core, which will results in you winning. Hopefully. That's the plan anyway.

Due to it's unique cartoony art style as well as it's complex elements of strategy Awesomenauts is a great way to get into the MOBA genre. It has a very diverse range of characters to play as (which have all been very well voice acted and have their own theme tunes) and several maps which differ greatly due to one feature in each that shake up the gameplay hugely.

Do remember that as a MOBA, this game still does has a fairly steep learning curve due to other players not sucking as much as you do. But if you persevere and learn the game, it can get incredibly fun! Awesome game!
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Awesomenauts is a great game many people can and have put many hours into and not be bored. It is the perfect game to play with two friends and verse three other, or play by yourself online or offline to hone your skills. With more characters and content to come there is no reason you should not purchase this game when you will surely get your money's worth.

Pros:
+Great 3-player team combat
+Lovable 'nauts
+Stunning visuals
+Beautiful soundtrack
+Nice progression/skill tracking
+Offline capabilities for when the wifi is down
+Plenty of content to keep you satisfied

Cons:
-Matchmaking could be improved

reviewText: Awesomenauts is a 2D-perspective MOBA with a lot of interesting character combinations and effective playstyles.  This game is best enjoyed with a team that is of similar skill level, although you can also join random teams for online battles.  Like all MOBAs, certain characters always seem to have balance issues, but overall the gameplay is fun and the team dynamics provide many hours of enjoyment.\n\nIf you want to play any of the 4 expansion characters, I recommend buying the Power Pack, as it can usually be found at a better discount than buying the game and the expansion separately.  Costumes are purely cosmetic, but add some nice variety if you play a lot of Awesomenauts.

reviewText: I have put many hours into this and purchased a lot of DLC. I supported the kickstarter Starstorm campaign also. It's just fantastic for a MOBA/PLATFORM/TURRET DFENCE game. Although that is what people call it I would ignore that description and say it's a multiplayer platform game. It reminds me of playing Smash Bros Mele many years ago on the gamecube. There is a learning curve, but it can be worked through. I'm league 3 now and it is challenging against other players, the main thing is to work as a team, even if the are strangers, knowing where you should be and where to defend or when to push is the key to winning. There's 4 levels (one more to come in the dlc), there's so many characters I've lost count. Each character has a jump/mele or shoot attack, and then two specials. Each can be upgraded to give either more damage or slowing effects etc. You can only pick three upgrades for each skill so you do have to think about it, although usually you'll find you stick to the same pattern that works for you. You have the light characters and heavy support types, something for everyones play style. The only criticisim is the matchmaking can sometimes be unfair, and put you against a team of three people, and are in higher league so the game ends quickly. The developers are however patching the matchmaking soon apparently.... They are very good and do live streams to reveal the patchs and what to be expected. I think this is a great game and no 'paywall' the dlc's that you buy are purely cosmetic, but I like to support the game so I do buy a lot of them (steam sales, get them for pennies). Anyway, I could go on but you should really just get the game now! Also go to their homepage and buy it via humble bundle you save a few penny and support them directly.

reviewText:
Now I've only logged a minimal amount of time into this game compared to the hundreds of hours played by the top reviewers, but I will give my opinion to boost up this game's rep. Also since it's a dollar right now, like when I bought it last year, I thought I should write to you who are viewing this product.

Awesomenauts is a platformer MOBA, a very unique gameplay experience that I found quite enjoyable. The game can be played with a gamepad or keyboard, both work quite well. There are a good number of different Awesomenauts to play as with interesting gameplay mechanics. Some I have found to be very overpowered and not fun to play against. The multiplayer matchmaking is also troublesome at times, like putting you into a game that is in progress that had an empty slot. In some ways this is good for that team's other players, but at the same time it is annoying for the joining player.

One of my favorite parts of the game is that it has different stages to play on that usually feature a large neutral event or monster in the center that can be activated by either team for use on the other team, or that just occurs periodically. This I find much better than just playing the same stage over and over again like with Dota or LoL. I also like the progression system with xp and unlocking new Awesomenauts, stages, and ranks. As you play you get a ranking of sorts that I do not know much about but I believe it allows the matchmaking to match you with other players of similar skill.

With this game, I have found it to be fun at times, but not very captivating in comparison to my other games and that is why I've played so little of it in a year. However, I do not in any way regret getting this game for 99 cents. I am definitely sure that this game would also be a lot more fun to play with friends too. Since the price is so low I have not really gone into the issues I find with the game or its detractors, as I do not expect too much from a game so cheap. It is important to note though, that the game does get periodical updates as well as new content.

I hope this review helped you with your decision. Thanks!

reviewText:
Awesomenauts is to League of Legends what Team Fortress 2 is to Call of Duty. It's a blast.

Awesomenauts is a 2D sidescrolling Multiplayer Online Battle Arena (MOBA) in which you and your team of two other colourful galactic battlers (the nauts) have to destroy the opposing team's drill. Between the start of the game, launched into battle from outer space to destroying the enemy base, it is a hectic, fast-paced, shout-inducing, high-five encouraging fight to the death, where all matter of technological, biological, and even psychic abilities are utilized.

All these characters and abilities have been neatly balanced. The levelling system makes it very easy to learn, and the humor, gameplay and plain fun will quickly draw you in.

This is by far my favourite online game bar none. Awesome!

reviewText: Words cannot describe how much I love this game.\n\nIn short, it is a fusion of MOBA and a platformer, so it requires both good reflexes and some planning. reviewText:
Awesomenauts is a very addictive, actionpacked and fun 3 vs. 3, 2D platform MOBA featuring:

+ lovely cartoon graphics
+ 16 Awesomenauts with 2 unique skills and 24 upgrades for each (+5 extra nauts with expansion)
+ 5 maps with special gameplay mechanics
+ custom games options for individual games
+ offline games (against bots), local and online multiplayer
+ high replay value due to the easy to learn, but hard to master fighting system
+ an active developer team that is still adding new content (even after more than 2 years after release)
- not perfect, but moderate balancing
- occasional lags caused by the peer-to-peer network structure
- moderate matchmaking (which should be fixed in a couple of months)

Best game I've played yet! Highly recommended!:)

reviewText:
Now I've only logged a minimal amount of time into this game compared to the hundreds of hours played by the top reviewers, but I will give my opinion to boost up this game's rep. Also since it's a dollar right now, like when I bought it last year, I thought I should write to you who are viewing this product.

Awesomenauts is a platformer MOBA, a very unique gameplay experience that I found quite enjoyable. The game can be played with a gamepad or keyboard, both work quite well. There are a good number of different Awesomenauts to play as with interesting gameplay mechanics. Some I have found to be very overpowered and not fun to play against. The multiplayer matchmaking is also troublesome at times, like putting you into a game that is in progress that had an empty slot. In some ways this is good for that team's other players, but at the same time it is annoying for the joining player.

One of my favorite parts of the game is that it has different stages to play on that usually feature a large neutral event or monster in the center that can be activated by either team for use on the other team, or that just occurs periodically. This I find much better than just playing the same stage over and over again like with Dota or LoL. I also like the progression system with xp and unlocking new Awesomenauts, stages, and ranks. As you play you get a ranking of sorts that I do not know much about but I believe it allows the matchmaking to match you with other players of similar skill.

With this game, I have found it to be fun at times, but not very captivating in comparison to my other games and that is why I've played so little of it in a year. However, I do not in any way regret getting this game for 99 cents. I am definitely sure that this game would also be a lot more fun to play with friends too. Since the price is so low I have not really gone into the issues I find with the game or its detractors, as I do not expect too much from a game so cheap. It is important to note though, that the game does get periodical updates as well as new content.

I hope this review helped you with your decision. Thanks!

reviewText: Awesomenauts is a fun action packed indie game that both children and adults can play and have fun with! The good about this game is that the best version only costs $10-15 and you can get a lot of content out of just that! There are so many different characters too choose from and they all are most likely gonna be unfamilier too you which gives this franchise a good opening! Also, this game is online multiplayer which means you can play with all your friends that also own the game! I also like how each character gets different abilities and just the idea of destroying security[turrets] to get to eachother's base is just pure AWESOME! There actually isn't much bad about this game other than there is no storymode to play and i think that would of given you alot more content and would of told you a lot more about the characters! Over all, this game is Awesome and would get a 9 out of 10 stars in my opinion!-NickTendo69

reviewText:
I would not recommend this game until they fix their matchmaking system.

This game suffers from the same issue with other games that rely on ranks. High skilled players just create new accounts because they don't want to actually play with a challenge. With no way to report them you just have to sit there and deal with it.
Their system of dealing with players leaving is also broken as hell. They try to replace missing players with bots which just gives the enemy free kills because the AI on bots suck and the enemy team gets extra solar (money) allowing them to be even more fed.

Then you have the problem with collision where on certain maps you have characters that take up the entire walkway so you get two enemies one on each side and you are automatically dead.

This game is NOT finished. It needs a LOT of work on balancing, the matchmaking system, dealing with players leaving, the ranking system and more.

reviewText:
A 3v3 MOBA 2D platformer. Now that is a lot of genres put together, but the blend of seemingly distant genres is done very well.

This is one of the more fast-paced MOBAs out there, but that makes it more enjoyable to me.

Individual skill is a very dominant part of this game, and 90% of the time, if something goes wrong, there was something you could have done to help prevent it. Of course that's not always the case.

If you like 2D platformer games with a competitive atmosphere, then pick up this game. It's also better to bring a friend of two along, as that just helps make it even more enjoyable.

reviewText:
A really good Game, i would REALLY like to see it as a new ESL MOBA.
BUT, and here comes the but:
- Many Characters are unbalanced and still too strong
- You shouldn't add buyable Characters. That destroys a competitive Game, focus on Skins, that doesn't destroys the Gameplay. Its just unfair to pay real Money so that you are ALLOWED to play Nauts that are in this game.

- Map Balance. Some Maps like the ''jungle'' Map are good balanced, with many Creeps to restore your health, and bosses to fight against to earn more money. But Maps like the Space Stations are unbalanced as hell, because once you hold the middle, where the only creeps are, you get constant health while the enemy team has to go back to base.
- Gameplay Balance. AGAIN the Balance. If you got 3 people who are good at this game, just push 1 lane, and to 90% you always win. The turrets should be MUCH stronger and shouldn't have a consistent life bar. So its basically just [hit, run away, hit again, run away] until the turret is down plus, there are no servers. Peer2Peer and you get killed behind turrets. Great.
Also, the ranking system is not existing. You, with 5 hours get easily connected to people with 2000 hours. So the ranks are making no sense at all.

- And the biggest problem of all: The base. Once all turrets are down, i guarantee you to 99% you will lose this game.
The nauts can attack the base, while droids can spawn without problems, helping them. YOUR droids cant do anything, because they all spawn infront of the base, so theres almost NO chance to turn the game around, because you don't have turrets anymore. People just hit the base until it has 1-10% of life, then they just wait for you to push, and they go alone in there and finish it. That is certainly damn stupid and you can easily destroy the base, without ANY chance of pushing back. The base should regenerate itself and should have a little undestroyable turret. That would make it MUCH harder to attack the base without Mercy.

And of course the Community: You ever played COD, LoL or any other Multiplayer Game? Yes?
Well forget all of it. NO community in the world is as worse, as the Awesomenauts Community.
People play 1-10 destroy the base and write ''eZ noobs''
You barely lost a game because a teammate disconnects? ''Deinstall game you f.aggot''
You died because an enemy has the perfect counter naut for you? ''Learn how to play m.otherf.ucker''
You died because an enemy is lagging around and you cant hit him? ''You are so bad, eZ''
You destroyed the enemy base? ''LoL you guys suck eZ''
You destroyed a turret? ''Play fair you noob''

If Ronimo would work more on the gameplay, instead of putting new buyable annoying nauts in the game, it would actually be REALLY good.

But until then, we just have to wait.
7/10. Would recommend, if you can ignore the community.

reviewText:
Gonna start with cons first so you know I don't fully support this game just yet. The bots are terrible. They have no common sense and will leave you with the enemy team for no apparent reason. Not to mention, there are times where a bot will just go to an isolated place and stay there for moments at a time. The in-game upgrade unlock system is wonky, the community is awful, and the character packs are too expensive.

The pros: Fun gameplay and original characters. Not all characters seem to be balanced, as some feel a lot weaker than others, and some feel a lot stronger. But overall, it's a pretty enjoyable game and definitely worth being checked out.

6.5/10

reviewText: This game is incredibly fun. The sidescroller aspect to a MOBA is one I hadn't considered before and it really works well. Learning the game is a much easier task than in other MOBAs and the character builds are varied but simple enough that newbies can get them quickly without having to look them up. Games usually take anywhere from 1/6-1/4 the time a match of DOTA2 would take. The music is excellent and ridiculous, which perfectly sets the tone for the environments, characters, and pace of the game. Awe of the fun factor can, unfortunately, turn into frustration after several days of gameplay. The meta game is very unbalanced at the moment which is not a huge problem for most MOBAs considering the large roster of choices most have. Awesomenauts doesn't have that luxury and it becomes an issue when at least 5 of the characters aren't worth playing at higher levels. The game clearly needs fairly constant tweaking as with most MOBAs but it's a great way to pass the time and to take a break from work.

reviewText:
A great concept, good sense of humor and an awesome diversity of characters... only too bad their online matching algorithm blows.

I like this game, trust me, I do. Only every second match I try to play online our league 5-7 team gets matched against league 2-3 opponents, which results in us getting completely steamrolled. We can beat bots easily, have fun playing against each other, but we cannot seem to improve enough to close this huge skillgap.

This makes every online match a gamble: will we get matched against (roughly) equally capable opponents? Or will the teams be so badly matched one of the sides gets inevitably steamrolled?

If the second happens, prepare for a 10-20 minute waiting/suffering simulator where every strategy you try and every time you slip up even the slightest is immediately punished by much more experienced opponents who slowly make their way towards your base. In my opinion, not fun in the slightest.

reviewText:
Very nice game, in short, it's a simplified, casual and 2D DOTA.
Pros:
Easier to start off with than DOTA/LoL
Each character has their own music and items, so each 'naut has more depth
Quick matchmaking and short matches mean fast paced gameplay
Brilliant characters with awesome voice actors  (including TotalBiscuit, Jesse Cox and Myndflame)

Cons:
Online lag can detract from your experience, but it is not too rampant.
Naut balancing can be iffy, but Ronimo are always improving the game in patches.

So overall I really reccomend this game to anyone who enjoys MOBAs and strategy games.

reviewText:
The game is incredibly fun. It is a cross between a Platformer and a Moba. Two of my favourite genres.
The characters feel unique and the in-game music is fantastic. You can never get tired of the killing spree music.

Compared to other Mobas this feels easier and more fun to pick up. The item builds are more straightforward, so I never felt the need to look up any guides or anything. If anything figuring stuff out on my own has made me a better player.
This is a bit more twitch reflex, fast paced Moba.

One valid concern is that the game is peer to peer and doesn't have a central server and lattency is not uncommon. This will be addressed in part in the new matchmaking. In my own experience this has never been a major factor in my over all experience.

Also as any other moba, people are pretty childish and will not hesitate to waste their energy to insult you. If you feel affercted by toxicity, there is an option to desable the chat altogether.

Ronimo is in my experience a very transparent company and has continued to improve the game through years. Sometimes it means they make a big change and it might upset some people, but overall they have continued to improve and support the game.

To address, some complains towards Overdrive update. A lot of people have complained about Ronimo not having released the new map yet. In they're stream Ronimo explained that it will be released with a new updates, a long with a new matchmaking system and a new free Naut for everybody owning the base game. I actually think it is a good thing to get things sooner rather than later. I think the majority of complaints are due to lack of information.

I would recommend anyone who enjoys Moba or Platformer genre to give this game a try.

reviewText:
When I first started playing the game and endured through the initial presentation/voice acting I thought to myself - This is going to be so bad... but what else could I expect for the price?

Then I started playing the practice match... and it was fairly ok.

... I then moved on to on-line gaming, and I played the first...

... and the second,

... and the third...

until I had to stop because I was told I should prepare dinner otherwise we would starve.

Basically, it is a sort of pvp 3vs3 tower defense game. You have to destroy the enemy core and bash some turrets along the way, while the other group is trying to do the same. The characters have very distinct characteristics and playing with a different one will force you to change your approach and strategy.

What can I say , it is a very entertaining game and generates interesting battles, provided that you chose a character that suits your game style.

It is a very enjoyable way to waste time. And I say waste" in a good way
recommended: the time will fly and you will forget about some of your pressing obligations - such has eating"

reviewText: Two moba style games I will always come back to. Heroes of the Storm. And Awesomenauts, the only side scrolling action moba I know of, and the only real chalanger for the most fun MOBA I've played. With crazzy characters, and endless refrences to the long gone, but not forgotten age of Saturday Morning Cartoons. reviewText:
Awesomenauts is an interesting case.

Its artstyle and sound-design are top-notch: consistent and well-rendered, with a nostalgic Saturday-morning cartoon vibe.  Every character has their own catchy theme that plays during killstreaks and character selection, and they all have unique personalities and gimmicks.  When Lonestar throws dynamite, Yuri fires his laser, etc., there's this audiovisually satisfying WEIGHT to the actions that's hard to put into words.

From an aesthetic standpoint, this game has few contenders.

Now, onto the bad.  For all of its cartoonish charm, Awesomenauts suffers from a broken matchmaking system and painfully-unbalanced characters.  The buy-in DLC characters have ridiculous abilities that can lock down an entire game with minimal effort, and it's not uncommon to see competitive teams placed in matchmaking against rank 9 newbies.  Add in the fact that the ladder actively punishes players for losing teambased matches (rather than, say, poor game-to-game performance), and you have a frustrating ladder that only benefits organized play.  Maybe I'm just salty
date: or perhaps I've just been unlucky.  Regardless, that's my experience.\n\n4/10

reviewText: This game is very fun.  It's side-scroller shooter.  It may look like a basic game at first but it's very addictive.  You play play on a team of 3 vs 3.  Each character has a special ability and all characters can level up.  As you level up you unlock more weapons and abilities.  All charaters have a basic attack but the special attacks are the ones that help you win the battle and help you decide which character is your favorite.  Once you get real good at a character it gets easier and more fun.  The object of the game is to destroy the other team's base.  Each team has turrents that guard the base.  You must take out the turrents and attack the base.  There's unlimited respawn but as the match progresses the respawn time gets longer.  This game can be played online or single player.  Single player is practice mode but still counts toward your character upgrades.
